data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.15.0 - OS Version: MacOSX/WIndows10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a new TypeScript file. Enter ```ts var a = { test: unknwwn } ``` The error correctly shows beneath variable `unknwwn`, says cannot find name. 2. Collapse/fold the object literal, error occurs at the end of line. Change the variable name `a` to `adddd`, just adding some keys. Note, error is not located at the end of line. Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature request : add the possibility of renaming a terminal.
data.body:
This is not a bug, but a feature request.
while I am working I tend to have multiple terminals running gulp or docker logs on the same time.
I often lose track of which is which. because If I am using gulp on multiple terminal instance in the select option the only information I have is that those terminal are running gulp.

so having an option to rename a terminal would be really helpful.

data.title: how to debug npm scripts link the follow in vscode?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:1.15.1 (1.15.1)
- OS Version:10.12.6

My package.json:
```
{
  "name": "ued-react",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "dependencies": {
    "react": "^15.6.1",
    "react-dom": "^15.6.1",
    "react-scripts": "1.0.13"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "debug": "react-scripts start",
    "start": "react-scripts start",
    "build": "react-scripts build",
    "test": "react-scripts test --env=jsdom",
    "eject": "react-scripts eject"
  }
}
```
My launch.json:
```
{
    // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible Node.js debug attributes.
    // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
    // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch via NPM",
            "runtimeExecutable": "npm",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "run",
                "debug"
            ]
        },
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${file}"
        }
    ]
}
```


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start Launch via NPM,
2.Produced error: "无法连接到运行中的进程，将在10000毫秒后超时 - （原因：无法连接到目标：connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:27520）"


Terminal show :"Debugging with inspector protocol because a runtime executable is set.
npm --inspect=27520 --debug-brk run debug "

Specificly, I have installed vscode with the gitlens extension and get this error:

Scan type: Auto-Protect Scan
Event: Risk Found!
Security risk detected: VBS.Downloader.Trojan
File: C:\Users\xxx\.vscode\extensions\eamodio.gitlens-4.4.2\node_modules\copy-paste\platform\fallbacks\paste.vbs

data.title: Lag after missclicking on a big file
data.body:
- VSCode Version : 1.15.1
- OS Version : GNOME Shell 3.24.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a global research on the project (Ctrl + Maj + F)
2. Missclick on/select a really big file like `index.js.map` with thousands of line (3.2Mo)
3. Try to work on other files but VSC got serious lagging problems. Like typing some code that come in screen with a second of delay.

The only solution I found is to quit and then launch again VSC. But it's a little bit boring because I run webpack with VSC's terminal, so I have to launch it again.
Not a huge issue in fact.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
I tried to reproduce it without extensions but this bug doesn't always appear when I made the steps, extensions disable or not.

Hope I've could help you to improve VSC :)

data.title: Same file opened twice
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
(Also using Arduino and C/C++  )
- OS Version: Windows 10 + shared disk on Cubestation cs407.
Steps to Reproduce: ??


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No Can't tell. 

Sometimes files opens both as they were named, like filename.h, and sometimes they **also** open as FILENAME.H in the tab. Having same file opened twice causes all types of issues. 
Most probably , this shows up sometimes/always when using "find in files" or "replace in files"
( I can't promise I've noticed all times it has happened. )

This on a project stored on a shared disk on the Cubestation.

data.title: ListWidget: weird index access
data.body: There is an access to properties to `this.rendered` [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/browser/ui/list/listWidget.ts#L89) where a string is used (`key_${start + i}`), however it seems that `this.rendered` is only filled with index as number, not as string.

data.title: TypeScript keeps removing/adding my project
data.body: I have noticed this since we have switched to 2.5.1/2. When ever I switch files it takes very long to get quick outline again. Having the (`terse`) log, I see that TypeScript keeps removing and opening the project. [Archive.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1274005/Archive.zip)

data.title: Duplicate clean up pattern
data.body:
It looks to me that the patterns defined [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/telemetry/common/telemetryService.ts#L56) are overlapping:

* `/file:\/\/\/.*?\/resources\/app\//gi`
* `/file:\/\/\/.*/gi`

The second seems to always match on the same things that the first matches on.

It is also not clear to me what the first pattern is trying to achieve and why it is being so specific about `resources/app`

data.title: Add support for disabling formatter for a code block
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:18.034Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601

This is a feature request. I wanted a way to disable formatter for a block of code based on some sort of annotations. This will be handy for cases that are not yet supported by VSCode formatter. For example, support for dynamic imports were added in [v1.14](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_14#_languages). Before that `import()` statements were not getting formatted properly.

data.title: Provide option to disable drag and drop in File Explorer
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

After accidentally dragging and dropping a folder in the explorer and not only not knowing where the folder was originally, but the name of the folder moved, I would like to be able to turn off drag and drop in the file explorer. 

Or, perhaps to phrase this in terms of the problem rather than a proposed solution, I would like there to be some friction when moving files and folder through drag and drop in the Explorer.

An informal survey of my circle of dev friends shows 100% of us have done this at some point in time. 

Thanks for all the work that has gone into this fantastic editor.

Cheers,

Kevin

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use WIndows Insider to update on the slow ring builds which have the new OneDrive place holder feature. 
2. Try to save a new file you just created from within VSCode.
You get the error shown in the screenshot, I've never ever had a problem before until recently, like weeks.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No
Yes 
Happened first time in the interactive playground I was reading the tips and tricks.  I tried again , choosing the command from the menu instead of using TAB and it worked, I tried again with the TAB key and it didnt.  I opened a new file and tried it there, it didnt work.  I tried again with the menu and it didnt work.  Have not been able to get it to work again - it worked once from the menu.

data.title: VSCode 1.15.1 w/ PowerShell extension 1.4.1 ignores language-specific tabSize for Format Document
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On an otherwise fresh install of VSCode 1.15.1, using PowerShell extension 1.4.1, with user settings configured as follows. The global `editor.tabSize` is `5` only for illustrative purposes, of course.

```
{
    "files.defaultLanguage":  "powershell",
    "editor.tabSize":  5,
    "[powershell]":  {
        "editor.detectIndentation":  false,
        "editor.tabSize":  2
    }
}
```

2. Open a .ps1 script file containing the following code. Lines subsequent to the first are indented by **4** spaces.

```
Get-ChildItem -LiteralPath C:\Windows\System32 |
    Where-Object {$_ -is [System.IO.FileInfo]} |
    Where-Object Extension -in .cpl,.msc |
    Sort-Object Length -Descending |
    Select-Object -First 10 |
    Select-Object Name,Length
```

3. Notice that the status bar at the bottom of the VSCode window indicates the language is detected as **PowerShell**, and appears to show the language-specific `editor.tabSize` (**Spaces: 2**).

4. Now right-click within the editor, and select **Format Document** from the context menu.

5. The indentation will now be **five** spaces. The global setting has been applied, and the language-specific setting has been ignored.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No
